intro: Linaria sardoa, commonly known as the Sardinian toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the island of Sardinia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its vibrant yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, arid environments. Its slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves are adapted to withstand the harsh Mediterranean climate. Linaria sardoa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
